Class MergeNodeReducer<K>

                      org.kiji.mapreduce.lib.reduce.MergeNodeReducer<K>
Type Parameters:
K - The type of the MapReduce key (the same type is used for input and output).
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, org.kiji.mapreduce.avro.AvroKeyWriter, org.kiji.mapreduce.avro.AvroValueWriter, org.kiji.mapreduce.KVOutputJob
public class MergeNodeReducer<K>
extends NodeValueReducer<K>

Merges nodes with the same label together.

Each input collection of nodes with the same input key will be processed together. Within the collection, each group of nodes with the same label will be merged into a single node.

When combined with a gatherer that produces (K, Node) pairs, this reducer is the utility knife of aggregate analysis. The gatherer's output records are grouped by key by the MapReduce framework. The MergeNodeReducer's reduce() method is called once per group. The nodes in the group are merged into a single node (see com.wibidata.core.client.lib.graph.NodeUtils for the merging algorithm). The aggregation method of the merged node is determined by the merge.node.aggregate.type configuration variable.

This allows you to compute aggregates "sliced" by the gatherer output key. See the Gather Data Model Example of the User Guide for an example.
